1 #ifndef SF_EULER_H
2 #define SF_EULER_H 1
3 
4 #include <emsr/detail/sf_euler.tcc>
5 #include <emsr/sf_gamma.h> // binomial
6 
7 namespace emsr
8 {
9 
10  /**
11  * @brief This returns Euler number @f$ E_n @f$.
12  *
13  * @param n the order n of the Euler number.
14  * @return The Euler number of order n.
15  */
16  template<typename Tp>
17  inline Tp
18  euler(unsigned int n)
19  { return emsr::detail::euler<Tp>(n); }
20 
21  /**
22  * Return the Eulerian number of the first kind.
23  * The Eulerian numbers of the first kind are defined by recursion:
24  * @f[
25  * \genfrac{\langle}{\rangle}{0pt}{0}{n}{m}
26  * = (n-m)\genfrac{\langle}{\rangle}{0pt}{0}{n-1}{m-1}
27  * + (m+1)\genfrac{\langle}{\rangle}{0pt}{0}{n-1}{m}
28  * \mbox{ for } n > 0
29  * @f]
30  * Note that @f$ A(n,m) @f$ is a common older notation.
31  */
32  template<typename Tp>
33  inline Tp
34  eulerian_1(unsigned int n, unsigned int m)
35  { return emsr::detail::eulerian_1<Tp>(n, m); }
36 
37  /**
38  * Return a vector of Eulerian numbers of the first kind.
39  */
40  template<typename Tp>
41  inline std::vector<Tp>
42  eulerian_1(unsigned int n)
43  { return emsr::detail::eulerian_1<Tp>(n); }
44 
45  /**
46  * Return the Eulerian number of the second kind.
47  * The Eulerian numbers of the second kind are defined by recursion:
48  * @f[
49  * \left\langle\genfrac{\langle}{\rangle}{0pt}{0}{n}{m}\right\rangle
50  * = (2n-m-1)
51  * \left\langle\genfrac{\langle}{\rangle}{0pt}{0}{n-1}{m-1}\right\rangle
52  * + (m+1)
53  * \left\langle\genfrac{\langle}{\rangle}{0pt}{0}{n-1}{m}\right\rangle
54  * \mbox{ for } n > 0
55  * @f]
56  */
57  template<typename Tp>
58  inline Tp
59  eulerian_2(unsigned int n, unsigned int m)
60  { return emsr::detail::eulerian_2<Tp>(n, m); }
61 
62 } // namespace emsr
63 
64 #endif // SF_EULER_H
